receivedRecommendations.givenAt: December 5, 2023, Theodora was Eugenia‚Äôs client
receivedRecommendations.description:
I recently had an impactful mentoring session with Eugenia Merkier during the "the BREAK" accelerator program, and I'm eager to share the profound influence it had on my startup journey.

Eugenia's unique approach to mentoring, focused on unlocking solutions through creativity, provided fresh insights for my startup, travelout. Her guidance in creative problem-solving was both enlightening and tailored to the specific challenges of an early-stage venture.

What stood out was Eugenia's authentic passion for fostering growth and innovation. She wasn't just a mentor but a true ally, creating a space where I felt comfortable sharing aspirations and challenges.

As a CEO, navigating the startup world is complex, but Eugenia's fresh perspective sparked a new wave of creativity within me. Our session became a catalyst for reimagining possibilities, setting the stage for travelout's continued evolution.

In the fast-paced startup landscape, having a mentor like Eugenia is invaluable. Her commitment to unlocking solutions makes her a gem in mentorship.

I'm grateful for the transformative experience with Eugenia Merkier. I recommend her to any aspiring entrepreneur seeking impactful mentorship.

headline: HR Specialist | Talent & People Development | Mentoring & Team Growth | International HR
about:
Human Resources professional with over 6 years of experience in multinational companies, managing processes for the U.S. and the Caribbean. I have contributed to system implementations, audits, compliance, and reporting, while mentoring junior team members and collaborating closely with HRBPs and managers. Currently based in Spain, I am looking to grow in HR Generalist / Junior HRBP or HR Consulting roles, with a focus on recruitment, talent development, and building strong employee experiences.

Profesional de Recursos Humanos con m√°s de 6 a√±os de experiencia en empresas multinacionales, gestionando procesos para EE.‚ÄØUU. y el Caribe. He participado en la implementaci√≥n de sistemas, auditor√≠as, compliance y reporting, supervisando y acompa√±ando a miembros junior de mi equipo, y colaborando estrechamente con HRBPs y managers. Actualmente en Espa√±a, busco desarrollarme en roles de HR Generalist, HRBP Jr. o consultor√≠a de RRHH, con enfoque en reclutamiento, desarrollo de talento y mejora de la experiencia del empleado.

experience.description:
- Mentored and supported junior team members, fostering professional growth and team integration.
- Managed payroll processes for 3,000+ employees, ensuring accuracy and compliance.
- Collaborated with HRBP, Finance, and IT teams to resolve employee issues and optimize HR processes.
- Supported managers in employee-related inquiries and initiatives to strengthen engagement.
- Contributed to internal and external audits, ensuring compliance and risk control.
- Coordinated initiatives for process standardization across international teams.

- Led HR system (ADP, T&A) implementation and trained team members.
- Migrated and standardized payroll processes with international stakeholders.
- Managed payroll operations for US and Caribbean employees, ensuring compliance and efficiency.
- Produced management reports and strategic data analyses for HR decision-making.
- Ensured compliance with internal controls and payroll regulations.

- Coordinated employee benefits and contributions (401k, taxes, deductions).
- Prepared monthly reports and audit documentation for management and internal control.
- Managed payroll for multiple locations, ensuring accuracy and timely execution.
- Resolved complex employee inquiries and payroll issues.

- Managed employee profiles (hires, terminations, benefits, tax forms) in HR systems.
- Generated and analyzed reports to support process control and HR decisions.
- Assisted employees with inquiries and administrative requests.
- Processed bi-weekly payroll, ensuring accuracy and compliance with regulations.

- Assisted with payroll processes and post-payroll reporting.
- Responded to employee inquiries, providing accurate and timely support.
- Supported documentation management and data control.
- Participated in payroll processing and audits under supervision.

element.about:
Human Resources professional with over 6 years of experience in multinational companies, managing processes for the U.S. and the Caribbean. I have contributed to system implementations, audits, compliance, and reporting, while mentoring junior team members and collaborating closely with HRBPs and managers. Currently based in Spain, I am looking to grow in HR Generalist / Junior HRBP or HR Consulting roles, with a focus on recruitment, talent development, and building strong employee experiences.

Profesional de Recursos Humanos con m√°s de 6 a√±os de experiencia en empresas multinacionales, gestionando procesos para EE.‚ÄØUU. y el Caribe. He participado en la implementaci√≥n de sistemas, auditor√≠as, compliance y reporting, supervisando y acompa√±ando a miembros junior de mi equipo, y colaborando estrechamente con HRBPs y managers. Actualmente en Espa√±a, busco desarrollarme en roles de HR Generalist, HRBP Jr. o consultor√≠a de RRHH, con enfoque en reclutamiento, desarrollo de talento y mejora de la experiencia del empleado.

experience.description:

projects.title: "Maximizando la Gesti√≥n de Inventario de Drink's e Cia."
projects.description:
Como parte del proyecto final grupal del bootcamp de Data Analytics de Henry, trabajamos con "Drink's e Cia.", una empresa destacada en la distribuci√≥n de productos con una red de m√°s de 70 tiendas. La compa√±√≠a se especializa en la comercializaci√≥n de m√°s de doce mil productos de las marcas m√°s renombradas y exclusivas del sector de bebidas. El objetivo principal del proyecto fue abordar los desaf√≠os en la gesti√≥n del inventario, mejorando la capacidad de la empresa para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mantener una ventaja competitiva en el mercado.

Objetivos del Proyecto:

Almacenamiento Seguro de Datos: Inicialmente, los datos se almacenaron en una base de datos SQL Server y luego se migraron a Google Cloud Platform para mejorar la accesibilidad y la seguridad.

Creaci√≥n de un Flujo de Datos Eficiente: Dise√±amos un flujo de ingesta de datos que asegura la transferencia fluida y segura de la informaci√≥n desde el origen hasta la base de datos.

Estructura Inteligente de la Base de Datos: Implementamos un esquema de Data Warehouse (DWH) en forma de copo de nieve para organizar la base de datos de manera eficiente y escalable.

Automatizaci√≥n de la Actualizaci√≥n de Datos: Establecimos un m√©todo automatizado para la ingesta de nuevos datos, simulando la entrada regular de nueva informaci√≥n.

Dise√±o de una Interfaz Intuitiva: Dise√±amos una interfaz de usuario intuitiva y f√°cil de usar para los informes, utilizando botones, marcadores, im√°genes y otros elementos que mejoran la experiencia del usuario.

Este proyecto me permiti√≥ aplicar y desarrollar habilidades en gesti√≥n de datos, dise√±o de bases de datos, automatizaci√≥n y creaci√≥n de interfaces de usuario, contribuyendo significativamente a la optimizaci√≥n de la gesti√≥n de inventario de Drink's e Cia.

projects.title: "Expansi√≥n Estrat√©gica de Biogenesys con Python y Power BI"

Utilic√© datos sobre la incidencia de COVID-19, tasas de vacunaci√≥n y disponibilidad de infraestructuras sanitarias en varios pa√≠ses de la regi√≥n para apoyar la estrategia de expansi√≥n de la empresa.

Objetivos del Proyecto:

Desarrollo de Dashboards Interactivos: Cre√© dashboards en Power BI que permiten explorar datos desde m√∫ltiples perspectivas, facilitando decisiones informadas y estrat√©gicas.

Este proyecto me permiti√≥ aplicar y perfeccionar mis habilidades en an√°lisis de datos y visualizaci√≥n, contribuyendo significativamente a la estrategia de expansi√≥n de BIOGENESYS en Latinoam√©rica.

projects.title: "Maximizando la Gesti√≥n de Inventario de Drink's e Cia."
projects.description:
Como parte del proyecto final grupal del bootcamp de Data Analytics de Henry, trabajamos con "Drink's e Cia.", una empresa destacada en la distribuci√≥n de productos con una red de m√°s de 70 tiendas. La compa√±√≠a se especializa en la comercializaci√≥n de m√°s de doce mil productos de las marcas m√°s renombradas y exclusivas del sector de bebidas. El objetivo principal del proyecto fue abordar los desaf√≠os en la gesti√≥n del inventario, mejorando la capacidad de la empresa para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mantener una ventaja competitiva en el mercado.

Objetivos del Proyecto:

Almacenamiento Seguro de Datos: Inicialmente, los datos se almacenaron en una base de datos SQL Server y luego se migraron a Google Cloud Platform para mejorar la accesibilidad y la seguridad.

Creaci√≥n de un Flujo de Datos Eficiente: Dise√±amos un flujo de ingesta de datos que asegura la transferencia fluida y segura de la informaci√≥n desde el origen hasta la base de datos.

Estructura Inteligente de la Base de Datos: Implementamos un esquema de Data Warehouse (DWH) en forma de copo de nieve para organizar la base de datos de manera eficiente y escalable.

Automatizaci√≥n de la Actualizaci√≥n de Datos: Establecimos un m√©todo automatizado para la ingesta de nuevos datos, simulando la entrada regular de nueva informaci√≥n.

Dise√±o de una Interfaz Intuitiva: Dise√±amos una interfaz de usuario intuitiva y f√°cil de usar para los informes, utilizando botones, marcadores, im√°genes y otros elementos que mejoran la experiencia del usuario.

Este proyecto me permiti√≥ aplicar y desarrollar habilidades en gesti√≥n de datos, dise√±o de bases de datos, automatizaci√≥n y creaci√≥n de interfaces de usuario, contribuyendo significativamente a la optimizaci√≥n de la gesti√≥n de inventario de Drink's e Cia.

headline: Electronics Engineer. 15+ yrs of experience in diverse areas such as Power Electronics, Hi Speed and Mixed Signal Designs, Imaging Systems and EO Satellites Operations. Currently Staff Apps Engineer @ Analog Devices.
about: As an ambitious yet humble professional, I have a great passion for continuous learning and personal development. I have experience in digital electronics, signal acquisition and processing and power electronics. Nowadays, I am particularly interested in project management and project execution, as well as product development and customer support. My goal is to acquire strong skills in these areas and effectively apply them to achieve exceptional results. Since the beginning of  my career, I have worked in multidisciplinary teams distributed across the globe in different time zones with a rich cultural diversity. The challenge has been immense but very enriching. I am committed to professional growth and am willing to take on challenges to expand my knowledge and abilities in new fields.

headline: Fractional CTO | CISO - Sr. Engineer pushing CyberSecurity into the DevOps üåé - IoT enthusiast - Founder & Mentor üë®‚Äçüíª
about:
I‚Äôm a motivated, adaptable and responsible systems engineer with +26 years of experience in the IT world. My background encompasses Cybersecurity and DevSecOps, allowing me to navigate and secure complex technological landscapes effectively.

Throughout my career, I have been deeply involved in every aspect of the software development life cycle, collaborating with top-tier professionals under high-pressure environments. My project portfolio is diverse, spanning from analysis and design to implementation and deployment across a variety of applications.

For over a decade now, I have taken on management roles, enhancing my communication skills and enabling me to interact seamlessly with corporate leadership, clients, vendors, and partners. My expertise extends to areas such as IoT, automation, monitoring, containerization, and cloud computing (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS). My preferred programming languages are C# and Python.

As a passionate and curious learner, I constantly explore new technologies and advocate for open-source initiatives. My commitment to continuous learning and innovation drives my contributions to the ever-evolving tech landscape.

experience.description: As the head of engineering at Uelz, I am honored with the responsibility to lead and manage a team of gifted engineers to deliver high-quality software solutions for our fintech platform. I wear many hats including: DevSecOps, Automation and Monitoring, Cybersecurity and Coding while always trying to help and learn from our team.

Valencia Codes aims to be the biggest English-language technology community in Valencia. The technology sector in Valencia has been growing in recent years and international companies and workers are taking an increasingly important role. We aim to provide the no.1 place in Valencia for software developers to meet, learn and discuss technology.

We run 3 types of events:
- Valencia Codes Learning Club which meets every Monday evening.
- Valencia Codes Meetup where we bring you new speakers to talk on exciting topics in technology every month plus the chance to network afterwards.
- Valencia Codes Hackathons where we get together on a Saturday, divide into teams and work together on a challenge.

Join our Meetup to learn about upcoming events and hackathons:
https://www.meetup.com/valencia-codes/

Join our Telegram channel to continue the conversation:
https://t.me/valenciacodes

Initially joined as a software developer supporting internal tools and external projects across LATAM, Europe, and Africa.

Delivered custom applications for dashboards, web scraping, data analytics, and cybersecurity advisory to both internal teams and peer organizations.

Led the implementation of DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and secure development processes using Node.js, C#, SQL, and cloud services.

Mentored junior developers, scaled the engineering team, and helped the organization adapt to remote-first workflows during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Provided strategic guidance on data governance, digital infrastructure, and secure communication platforms for nonprofit initiatives.

Accountable for working with clients and their IT team members to understand their company requirements and provide analysis and design of quality technical solutions aligned with their corporate and IT strategies standards. Developing software while Operating the required infrastructure to keep it running smoothly.

Sr. DevOps Engineer working directly with SODA's observability platform infrastructure. SODA allows teams to discover, prioritise, and collaboratively resolve data issues. Our infra-team current tech stack requires AWS knowledge as our main cloud provider as well as Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Github Actions, Python and Datadog on a daily basis.

Lead engineer responsible for the adoption of a container based approach and its cloud final implementation. Automating and building an end-to-end CI/CD pipeline road from scratch. Testing, monitoring and refactoring accordingly while lining up continuously with a permanent changing and dynamic business. Mentor to new team members.

DevOps engineer working remotely on innovative projects for one of the Big 4. 

Proud member of the company's main team in charge of Security Architecture, Engineering, Innovation & Transformation that makes services available to millions of customers worldwide on a daily basis.

Responsible for the everyday IT requirements across the southern cone (Argentina, Uruguay, Chile, Brazil, Paraguay and Bolivia) office branches from corporate headquarters. element.headline: Fractional CTO | CISO - Sr. Engineer pushing CyberSecurity into the DevOps üåé - IoT enthusiast - Founder & Mentor üë®‚Äçüíª
element.about:
I‚Äôm a motivated, adaptable and responsible systems engineer with +26 years of experience in the IT world. My background encompasses Cybersecurity and DevSecOps, allowing me to navigate and secure complex technological landscapes effectively.

Throughout my career, I have been deeply involved in every aspect of the software development life cycle, collaborating with top-tier professionals under high-pressure environments. My project portfolio is diverse, spanning from analysis and design to implementation and deployment across a variety of applications.

For over a decade now, I have taken on management roles, enhancing my communication skills and enabling me to interact seamlessly with corporate leadership, clients, vendors, and partners. My expertise extends to areas such as IoT, automation, monitoring, containerization, and cloud computing (IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS). My preferred programming languages are C# and Python.

As a passionate and curious learner, I constantly explore new technologies and advocate for open-source initiatives. My commitment to continuous learning and innovation drives my contributions to the ever-evolving tech landscape.

experience.description: As the head of engineering at Uelz, I am honored with the responsibility to lead and manage a team of gifted engineers to deliver high-quality software solutions for our fintech platform. I wear many hats including: DevSecOps, Automation and Monitoring, Cybersecurity and Coding while always trying to help and learn from our team.

Valencia Codes aims to be the biggest English-language technology community in Valencia. The technology sector in Valencia has been growing in recent years and international companies and workers are taking an increasingly important role. We aim to provide the no.1 place in Valencia for software developers to meet, learn and discuss technology.

We run 3 types of events:
- Valencia Codes Learning Club which meets every Monday evening.
- Valencia Codes Meetup where we bring you new speakers to talk on exciting topics in technology every month plus the chance to network afterwards.
- Valencia Codes Hackathons where we get together on a Saturday, divide into teams and work together on a challenge.

Join our Meetup to learn about upcoming events and hackathons:
https://www.meetup.com/valencia-codes/

Join our Telegram channel to continue the conversation:
https://t.me/valenciacodes

Initially joined as a software developer supporting internal tools and external projects across LATAM, Europe, and Africa.

Delivered custom applications for dashboards, web scraping, data analytics, and cybersecurity advisory to both internal teams and peer organizations.

Led the implementation of DevOps practices, CI/CD pipelines, and secure development processes using Node.js, C#, SQL, and cloud services.

Mentored junior developers, scaled the engineering team, and helped the organization adapt to remote-first workflows during the COVID-19 pandemic.

Provided strategic guidance on data governance, digital infrastructure, and secure communication platforms for nonprofit initiatives.

Accountable for working with clients and their IT team members to understand their company requirements and provide analysis and design of quality technical solutions aligned with their corporate and IT strategies standards. Developing software while Operating the required infrastructure to keep it running smoothly.

Sr. DevOps Engineer working directly with SODA's observability platform infrastructure. SODA allows teams to discover, prioritise, and collaboratively resolve data issues. Our infra-team current tech stack requires AWS knowledge as our main cloud provider as well as Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Github Actions, Python and Datadog on a daily basis.

Lead engineer responsible for the adoption of a container based approach and its cloud final implementation. Automating and building an end-to-end CI/CD pipeline road from scratch. Testing, monitoring and refactoring accordingly while lining up continuously with a permanent changing and dynamic business. Mentor to new team members.

DevOps engineer working remotely on innovative projects for one of the Big 4.

about: Extensive professional experience as Account & Sales Manager acquired in the commercial areas of multinational companies. Specialties in business development and account management experience, prospect and identify new business opportunities. Focus on customer relationships and loyalty to innovative projects with profitable results. Proven financial success and quota goals.

profileTopEducation.schoolName: University of Connecticut School of Business

experience.position: International Sales Manager Europe & Middle East

experience.description: ‚Ä¢ Sales & Sales Management ‚Ä¢ Go to Market Strategy ‚Ä¢ Event Planning & Execution ‚Ä¢ Sales Program Design‚Ä¢ Collaboration and Communication ‚Ä¢ Global Brand Ambassador ‚Ä¢ Sales Process & Route Design and Implementation

Represent and promote the company throughout all projects achieving the profit targets of the Commercial department
Manage, coordinate and control the delivery of the projects.
Take control and manage through all stages of the Sales and Marketing process from initiation & planning, design, procurement, construction and completion & close-out stage
Work with the constraints of the project and deliver to meet all time, cost, quality, health & safety requirements of the project.
Communicate the needs requirements and constraints of the Client.
Represent the Client throughout the duration of the project.
Manage and coordinate the work of all consultants & contractors appointed to the project.

Kimberly-Clark has some of the most recognized brands in the world. Our brands hold the No. 1 or No. 2 share position in 80 countries, and we have five billion-dollar brands: Huggies, Scott, Kleenex, Cottonelle and Kotex. We are increasing the use of digital and non-traditional channels and programs to advertise our brands and build personal relationships with consumers. Kimberly-Clark Professional partners with businesses to create Exceptional Workplaces, helping to make them healthier, safer and more productive, with brands including Kleenex, Scott, WypAll, Kimtech and Jackson Safety.
Global hygiene and health company that develops, produces and sells Personal Care development. 

Responsible for a Sales and Marketing Argentina business
Results-oriented sales manager with exposure to business development, strategic sales planning and customer relationship management 
Implementation of the Regional Commercial Plan for strategic negotiations

The world leader in beauty, L‚ÄôOr√©al is present in 130 countries on five continents. The group's mission is to provide the best in cosmetics innovation to women and men around the world with respect for their diversity. Brands: Lanc√¥me, Biotherm, Kiehl's, Giorgio Armani, Keraste, Vichy, La Roche-Posay etc.
 
Implemented sales, merchandising and promotional programs for retail and wholesale accounts. Developed positive working relationship with store owners and managers. Responsible for the sales and distribution of new products and expansion of already established brands. Responsible for managing commercial support in assigned areas. Development the objectives and business plans in the markets. Daily and direct reports.

headline: CEO en JNS International Group - Consultoria en Comercio Internacional
about:
Escribir (Hablar) sobre mi, me resulta inc√≥modo, no me gusta tanto. Soy verborr√°gica, me encanta hablar con las personas, bueno con todo el mundo, y de todo,  Estaba haciendo un curso de Habilidades Digitales, y la Profe, me dijo: cambia esa presentaci√≥n, estas hablando de tu empresa y no de Vos.  Ufa, ok. Ac√° Voy...
Soy Cordobesa, de la ciudad de C√≥rdoba, Argentina.  Vivo en Espa√±a, en la provincia de Valencia, en la hermosa Playa de Gandia.  Pa√≠s elegido, y mi lugar hoy, descubierto por causalidad, una de las playas m√°s bonitas que tiene Espa√±a.  Reconocer, que aunque me he criado entre monta√±as y r√≠os, mi debilidad es el mar. Y ac√° estoy.  Haciendo lo que me gusta y apasiona. 
Disfruto de hacer Voluntariado en C√°ritas, algunas veces en Cruz Roja. Son acciones totalmente diferentes y a la vez, similares.  Sigo aprendiendo. en todos los aspectos y √°mbitos de mi vida.  Tambien sigo escribiendo, y disfrutando hacerlo, mensualmente mi columna en RedComProfesionales.
Actualmente, me dedico a la Consultor√≠a en Comercio Internacional.  Me ocupo de ayudar a empresas y emprendedores a posicionar sus marcas, productos y servicios en la parte del mundo que quieran.  Suena simple, y sabemos que no lo es, pero no es imposible.  lleva tiempo, procesos y gestiones. paciencia y mucha calma, y lo hacemos posible.  Me encanta lo que hago, la sinergia, la colaboratividad, el aprendizaje continuo, el intercambio cultural, las comunicaciones y redes que se tienden y nacen, a partir de ello. experience.position: Senior QA Automation Engineer/ Manual QA Analytics
experience.description:
Proyecto: MPS en "Inditex".
En este proyecto me encargo de armar el Plan de calidad, lo que incluye gestionar los planes de prueba en los distintos niveles de prueba. As√≠ como dise√±ar el plan de regresion y release, pruebas de progresi√≥n y dem√°s.  
‚Ä¢ Automatizaci√≥n de pruebas.

‚Ä¢ Utilizaci√≥n de Bitbucket como gestor de repositorio y CI/CD.
‚Ä¢ Comprensi√≥n funcional de la aplicaci√≥n.

Proyecto:  CSC en "El Corte Ingl√©s".
Este nuevo puesto requiere que haga an√°lisis de las historias de usuario, para definir los casos de prueba a implementar, seg√∫n los criterios de aceptaci√≥n. Luego dise√±ar los casos de prueba funcionales y realizar las pruebas manuales correspondientes. Todo esto antes de comentar a automatizar. 
‚Ä¢ Automatizaci√≥n de pruebas.
‚Ä¢ Automatizaci√≥n usandoJavaScript.
‚Ä¢ Automatizaci√≥n de aplicaciones web.
‚Ä¢ Utilizaci√≥n de Jira como gestor de tareas.
‚Ä¢ Utilizaci√≥n de Bitbucket como gestor de repositorio y CI/CD.
‚Ä¢ Tareas manuales de descripci√≥n de historias de usuario en RQM (IBM).
‚Ä¢ Comprensi√≥n funcional de la aplicaci√≥n.

‚Ä¢ Automatizaci√≥n de pruebas sobre CRM Dynamics Supervielle usando Lippia.
‚Ä¢ Automatizaci√≥n usando BDD (Cucumber for Java) y Gherkin.
‚Ä¢ Automatizaci√≥n de aplicaciones web (Java sobre Selenium).
‚Ä¢ Tutor en Academy.
‚Ä¢ Utilizaci√≥n de Jira como gestor de tareas.
‚Ä¢ Utilizaci√≥n de GitLab como gestor de repositorio y CI/CD.

Este puesto se desarrollaba en un Instituto de Educaci√≥n superior. Para acceder al cargo tuve que cumplir con algunos requisitos del puesto y rendir un examen ante el consejo directivo de la Instituci√≥n.
Siendo este un cargo Directivo en la gesti√≥n institucional mis tareas fueron muy amplias, desde el armado de planes de mejora institucional, proyectos, reuniones de equipo para resoluci√≥n de problemas, dictado de capacitaciones para el personal, administraci√≥n de los recursos humanos, coordinaci√≥n con las Direcciones de Gobierno, etc.

Este puesto se desarrollaba en un Instituto de Educaci√≥n Superior, donde se dictan carreras para formar profesionales en √°reas t√©cnicas y de formaci√≥n docente. En este trabajo las tareas principales eran el mantenimiento del servidor que funciona con sistema operativo Debian, y la topolog√≠a de la red dentro del edificio Institucional. A su vez las netbooks de los alumnos se bloquean si no se conectan con el servidor en cierto periodo de tiempo, as√≠ que otra tarea de este empleo era solucionar los problemas relacionados con bloqueos o mal funcionamiento de las mismas.

Este trabajo se desarrollaba en la direcci√≥n General de Escuelas. 
Entre mis tareas se encontraban, la atenci√≥n al p√∫blico para brindar informaci√≥n al respecto del √°rea administrativa, tambi√©n el armado armado de proyectos institucionales, orden y actualizaci√≥n de legajos, entre otras cosas.

publications.title: The Power of Visualization: Back to the Future for Pain Management in Fibromyalgia Syndrome
publications.description:
Objective
Previous studies have demonstrated the effects of positive psychological factors on pain adjustment. Specifically, optimism has been linked to better physical functioning and less psychological distress. Until recently, these beneficial effects have mostly been examined in correlational studies or laboratory settings. The aim of this study was to test the efficacy of the Best Possible Self intervention using information and communication technologies with fibromyalgia patients.

Methods
Seventy-one patients were randomly allocated to the Best Possible Self intervention or a Daily Activities control condition. The Best Possible Self intervention used an interactive multimedia system with the support of an Internet platform to practice the guided imagery exercise online.

Results
Intent-to-treat analyses showed that, compared with the control condition, Best Possible Self patients showed significant improvements in depression, positive affect, and self-efficacy at postintervention. Moreover, at three-month follow-up, patients who received the intervention improved their optimism and negative affect significantly more than participants in the control condition.

Conclusions
This study shows how a technology-supported intervention aimed at augmenting positive affect and promoting positive functioning works in the case of fibromyalgia, expanding the intervention‚Äôs efficacy data in clinical populations and adding knowledge about the role that positive psychological factors play in pain experience. Moreover, it demonstrates the specific effects of the Best Possible Self intervention in order to incorporate this exercise in pain treatment protocols.

KEYWORDS: Fibromyalgia, Treatment Outcome, Optimism, Best Possible Self, Self-Efficacy

publications.title: Integrating Virtual Reality with Activity Management for the Treatment of Fibromyalgia: Acceptability and Preliminary Efficacy.
publications.publishedAt: The Clinical journal of pain ¬∑ Dec 30, 2014
publications.description:
Cognitive-behavioral therapies (CBT) for fibromyalgia (FMS) are important interventions in the management of this condition. Empirical evidence reports that although the results are promising, further research is needed to respond more appropriately to these patients. This study focuses on exploring the use of Virtual Reality (VR) as an adjunct to the activity management component. The aim of this study is to present the results of a small-sized randomized controlled trial to test the preliminary efficacy and acceptability of this component.
The final sample was composed of 61 women diagnosed with FMS according to the American College of Rheumatology. The sample was randomly allocated to two conditions: VR treatment and treatment as usual.
Participants in the VR condition achieved significant improvements in the primary outcome: disability measured with the FIQ. The improvement was also significant in secondary outcomes, such as perceived quality of life and some of the coping strategies included in the CPCI: Task persistence, and Exercise. There were no differences in other secondary outcome measures like pain intensity and interference and depression. Participants reported high satisfaction with the VR component.
The effects were related to the psychological aspects targeted in the treatment. The component was well-accepted by FMS patients referred from a public hospital. These findings show that the VR component could be useful in the CBT treatment of FMS and encourage us to continue exploring the use of integrating VR with CBT interventions for the treatment of FMS.

doi: 10.1097/AJP.0000000000000196

publications.title: Virtual Reality for the Induction of Positive Emotions in the Treatment of Fibromyalgia: A Pilot Study over Acceptability, Satisfaction, and the Effect of Virtual Reality on Mood.
publications.publishedAt: Cyberpsychology, Behavior, and Social Networking ¬∑ Jun 1, 2014
publications.description: One of the most important aspects of fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS) is its impact on quality of life, increasing negative emotions and dysfunctional coping strategies. One of these strategies is to avoid activities, especially meaningful activities, which reduces positive reinforcement. Commencing significant daily activities could enable chronic patients to experience a more fulfilling life. However, the main difficulty found in FMS patients is their willingness to start those activities. Promoting positive emotions could enhance activity management. The aim of this paper is to present a description of a system along with data regarding the acceptability, satisfaction, and preliminary efficacy of a virtual reality (VR) environment for the promotion of positive emotions. The VR environment was especially designed for chronic pain patients. Results showed significant increases in general mood state, positive emotions, motivation, and self-efficacy. These preliminary findings show the potential of VR as an adjunct to the psychological treatment of such an important health problem as chronic pain.

publications.title: Ecological momentary assessment for chronic pain in fibromyalgia using a smartphone: A randomized crossover study
publications.description:
The present study compares the compliance and acceptability of an electronic diary running on a smartphone using a crossover design for a sample with a specific pain condition, fibromyalgia and low familiarity with technology. Forty-seven participants were randomly assigned to one of two conditions: (1) paper diary ‚Äì smartphone diary and (2) smartphone diary ‚Äì paper diary, using each assessment method for 1‚Äâweek.

The findings of this study showed that the smartphone diary made it possible to gather more accurate and complete ratings. Besides, this method was well accepted by a sample of patients with fibromyalgia referred by a public hospital, with an important proportion of participants with low level of education and low familiarity with technology.

publications.title: Smiling is Fun: A Coping with Stress and Emotion Regulation Program.
publications.publishedAt: Studies in health technology and informatics 01/2012; 181:123-7. ¬∑ Jan 1, 2012
publications.description: Emotional disorders (Anxiety disorders and Mood disorders) are one of the most common health problems worldwide, and their economic costs are very high. People suffering from emotional disorders often use maladaptive emotion regulation strategies and have low coping behaviour that contributes to the presence of clinical symptoms. For this reason, it is important to develop strategies to monitor coping and promote emotion regulation in people exposed to high levels of stress. Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) can help us in this task. Recent systematic reviews of literature on evidence-based CBT treatments delivered via the Internet show that these approaches are effective. We have developed an intervention program ICT based: Coping with Stress and Emotion Regulation Program (Smiling is Fun), a self-applied program via the Internet. Smiling is Fun follows a transdiagnostic perspective, and it is based on CBT techniques. However, it also includes other psychological strategies to improve positive mood. The aim of the present work is to describe Smiling is Fun and the study designed to test its efficacy.

publications.title: Diferencias en la Predicci√≥n Afectiva entre Poblaci√≥n Normal y Cl√≠nica: Un Estudio Preliminar.
publications.description:
Introducci√≥n: La predicci√≥n afectiva (Affective Forecasting) se podr√≠a definir como el pron√≥stico que hacemos sobre c√≥mo nos sentiremos en el futuro cuando un determinado evento ocurra. Los estudios muestran que cometemos errores de estimaci√≥n; tendemos a sobreestimar la intensidad de nuestras emociones, lo que se conoce como ‚Äúsesgo de intensidad‚Äù. En este estudio, se analiz√≥ si existe tal sesgo y si existen diferencias entre poblaci√≥n cl√≠nica y general. M√©todo: Participaron 11 voluntarios, con una media de edad de 33 a√±os (DT=15,62), de los cuales 6 corresponden a poblaci√≥n cl√≠nica y 5 a poblaci√≥n general. Los participantes realizaron un ejercicio de imaginaci√≥n en el que visualizaron su futuro de la mejor forma posible (Best self). Posteriormente, se les pidi√≥ que estimaran c√≥mo de tristes, felices, ansiosos y enfadados se sentir√≠an si eso que han imaginado ocurriese. Despu√©s de 6 meses, se volvi√≥ a contactar con ellos, y en caso de que hubiera ocurrido lo que imaginaron, se evalu√≥ la intensidad real de las emociones que experimentaron. Resultados: Aunque no se encontraron diferencias estad√≠sticamente significativas entre la estimaci√≥n y la emoci√≥n real, ni entre ambas muestras, si que se observaron diferencias  entre la estimaci√≥n y la emoci√≥n real de cada poblaci√≥n, y entre ambas poblaciones. Conclusiones: En ambas poblaciones se ha identificado el ‚Äúsesgo de impacto‚Äù  en algunas de las emociones , lo cual sugiere que determinadas emociones pueden ser proclives a estimarse con mayor o menor ajuste. 

Palabras clave: Predicci√≥n Afectiva, Sesgo de Intensidad, Emociones, Best Self, Poblaci√≥n Cl√≠nica.

publications.title: The Power of Visualization: Back to the Future for Pain Management in Fibromyalgia Syndrome
publications.description:
Objective
Previous studies have demonstrated the effects of positive psychological factors on pain adjustment. Specifically, optimism has been linked to better physical functioning and less psychological distress. Until recently, these beneficial effects have mostly been examined in correlational studies or laboratory settings. The aim of this study was to test the efficacy of the Best Possible Self intervention using information and communication technologies with fibromyalgia patients.

Methods
Seventy-one patients were randomly allocated to the Best Possible Self intervention or a Daily Activities control condition. The Best Possible Self intervention used an interactive multimedia system with the support of an Internet platform to practice the guided imagery exercise online.

Results
Intent-to-treat analyses showed that, compared with the control condition, Best Possible Self patients showed significant improvements in depression, positive affect, and self-efficacy at postintervention. Moreover, at three-month follow-up, patients who received the intervention improved their optimism and negative affect significantly more than participants in the control condition.

Conclusions
This study shows how a technology-supported intervention aimed at augmenting positive affect and promoting positive functioning works in the case of fibromyalgia, expanding the intervention‚Äôs efficacy data in clinical populations and adding knowledge about the role that positive psychological factors play in pain experience. Moreover, it demonstrates the specific effects of the Best Possible Self intervention in order to incorporate this exercise in pain treatment protocols.

KEYWORDS: Fibromyalgia, Treatment Outcome, Optimism, Best Possible Self, Self-Efficacy

publications.title: Integrating Virtual Reality with Activity Management for the Treatment of Fibromyalgia: Acceptability and Preliminary Efficacy.
publications.publishedAt: The Clinical journal of pain ¬∑ Dec 30, 2014
publications.description:
Cognitive-behavioral therapies (CBT) for fibromyalgia (FMS) are important interventions in the management of this condition. Empirical evidence reports that although the results are promising, further research is needed to respond more appropriately to these patients. This study focuses on exploring the use of Virtual Reality (VR) as an adjunct to the activity management component. The aim of this study is to present the results of a small-sized randomized controlled trial to test the preliminary efficacy and acceptability of this component.
The final sample was composed of 61 women diagnosed with FMS according to the American College of Rheumatology. The sample was randomly allocated to two conditions: VR treatment and treatment as usual.
Participants in the VR condition achieved significant improvements in the primary outcome: disability measured with the FIQ. The improvement was also significant in secondary outcomes, such as perceived quality of life and some of the coping strategies included in the CPCI: Task persistence, and Exercise. There were no differences in other secondary outcome measures like pain intensity and interference and depression. Participants reported high satisfaction with the VR component.
The effects were related to the psychological aspects targeted in the treatment. The component was well-accepted by FMS patients referred from a public hospital. These findings show that the VR component could be useful in the CBT treatment of FMS and encourage us to continue exploring the use of integrating VR with CBT interventions for the treatment of FMS.

doi: 10.1097/AJP.0000000000000196

publications.title: Virtual Reality for the Induction of Positive Emotions in the Treatment of Fibromyalgia: A Pilot Study over Acceptability, Satisfaction, and the Effect of Virtual Reality on Mood.
publications.publishedAt: Cyberpsychology, Behavior, and Social Networking ¬∑ Jun 1, 2014
publications.description: One of the most important aspects of fibromyalgia syndrome (FMS) is its impact on quality of life, increasing negative emotions and dysfunctional coping strategies. One of these strategies is to avoid activities, especially meaningful activities, which reduces positive reinforcement. Commencing significant daily activities could enable chronic patients to experience a more fulfilling life. However, the main difficulty found in FMS patients is their willingness to start those activities. Promoting positive emotions could enhance activity management. The aim of this paper is to present a description of a system along with data regarding the acceptability, satisfaction, and preliminary efficacy of a virtual reality (VR) environment for the promotion of positive emotions. The VR environment was especially designed for chronic pain patients. Results showed significant increases in general mood state, positive emotions, motivation, and self-efficacy. These preliminary findings show the potential of VR as an adjunct to the psychological treatment of such an important health problem as chronic pain.

headline: Product Owner | Project Manager | Software Engineer
about:
I'm a Software Engineer with over seven years of experience in product leadership, guiding cross-functional technical teams to build user-centered, functional, and intuitive solutions that meet business and client needs.

I specialize in bridging the gap between stakeholders and development teams, ensuring that every product decision aligns with both user experience and strategic goals. I thrive in collaborative environments where continuous learning, open communication, and shared growth are part of the culture.

I'm passionate about building high-impact products, learning from others, and contributing my experience to help teams grow stronger together.

- Created and maintained the product backlog
- Collaborated closely with the UX/UI team to ensure user-centered design

- Prioritized tasks and distributed work within the SCRUM team
- Coordinated release planning and delivery
- Maintained direct communication with clients to gather feedback and align expectations

- Created and maintained the product backlog
- Coordinated development, QA, and release processes

- Maintained direct communication with the client to ensure alignment and clarity

volunteering.description:
In 'Galgos Libres' we rescue greyhounds from abuse and neglect of people who use them to hunt or run dog races. We take them to foster homes while they are under medical treatment. These are family homes that give us their time and space for the duration of the dog's veterinary treatment.

Once they are discharged, we look for adoptive families.
Families that respect and care for them as they always deserved.

We also carry out awareness and education campaigns for the general population.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/galgoslibresrosario/
Instagram: @galgoslibres.rosario

I founded 'Vaciemos el Refugio de Carcara√±√°' to give visibility to the more than 90 dogs that lived locked in very small cages at the municipal dog shelter in Carcara√±√° city. Forgotten dogs with very little space to move, with very poor quality food and without veterinary attention.

After much work and dissemination, absolutely all the dogs in the shelter were responsibly adopted.

At the end, with the company of the Municipality of Carcara√±√° we collapsed the shelter so that no dog can be locked in that place ever again.

receivedRecommendations.description:
If "hidden gem" applied to a person, Luis would be it. The raw talent he has is absolutely bonkers. For real, the quality of everything that he makes is out of this world. I actually cannot wait to collaborate again with this man, he is that good. Great ear, great taste, he got everything in the first take. It's quite a remarkable skill.
And he even works great under very thin timeframes, which can generate lots of stress, but Luis always manages to remain call and deliver the exact same thing you were looking for (and more).

headline: T√©cnico en Prevenci√≥n de Riesgos Laborales
about:
Soy T√©cnico Superior en Prevenci√≥n de Riesgos Laborales, poseo un M√°ster Oficial en Prevenci√≥n de Riesgos Laborales con tres especialidades, otorgado por la Universidad Internacional de Valencia (Espa√±a). Adem√°s, cuento con el t√≠tulo de Licenciado en Higiene y Seguridad en el Trabajo por la Universidad Tecnol√≥gica Nacional (Argentina).

Me apasiona crear y mantener entornos laborales seguros, saludables y eficientes. Me destaco por mi enfoque proactivo, la capacidad de liderar equipos y una firme orientaci√≥n a la mejora continua.
